author: Fletcher Page
title: UPDATED: Nick Chubb knee injury will require surgery, UGA confirms
text:
In the stands: Fletcher Page & Dean Legge talk Georgia's latest loss 
UPDATED: 5:38 p.m. Sunday 
Nick Chubb suffered a, "significant' left knee injury at Tennessee and will require surgery, the university of Georgia announced Sunday. 
Coach Mark Richt said, "it's pretty safe to say" the sophomore running back is out for the season and he hopes to have him for the start of next season. 
Per the school release: 
"University of Georgia sophomore tailback Nick Chubb suffered a significant left knee injury on the first play from scrimmage in Saturday's Georgia-Tennessee game in Knoxville. According to UGA Senior Associate Athletic Director for Sports Medicine Ron Courson, the injury involves damage to multiple ligaments and cartilage; however, the damage does not include the anterior cruciate ligament (ACL). Neither does the injury involve arteries or nerves. Courson said all the damage is repairable and a full recovery is expected following surgery and rehab. Chubb is currently in the hospital for observation and surgery would be expected sometime in the next two weeks." 
Chubb tore the PCL in his injured left knee and will require surgery, according to a post made by his mother on Facebook. 
Chubb suffered the injury on the first play from scrimmage in Saturday's loss at Tennessee. 
La'Velle Chubb posted: 
"Gm, I thank God for being God and what an awesome God he is. Now I want to thank each and everyone of you for your prayers, text, calls etc. The outpouring of your love is an example of just how great God is. I can't thank you enough. Nick has A PCL tear along with 2 other ligaments. It's not nearly as bad as it could've been. They'll wait for swelling to go down to decide when to have surgery. Possibly 2wks. Nick is in good spirits. Moma on the other hand is trying to hold it together. This right here, along with a few other things just helps put things into perspective. I do not doubt God or His plans. As matter of fact, I know I'm on the right track. We are going to increase our time with God and continue watching him work. Stay tuned. " 
Chubb entered tied with Herschel Walker for the school record with 13 straight games with more than 100 yards rushing. He ranked third nationally with 745 yards on 91 carries and seven rushing touchdowns on the season.
